did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Manuscripts and Rare Books Librarian, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Adee Papers, Accession #Mss. 39.2 Ad3, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Letters received by Etta Adee, of Barrington, Yates Co., N.Y. from her brother John Adee, with the Union Army in Arkansas and Louisiana, 1863-1865, and from John S. Miller, of the 29th Regiment Iowa Infantry, stationed at St. Louis, Mo., 1862.

did.physdesc: ALS. 4pp. Contains 2 NCls dated Dec. 24, Dec. 25, and Dec. 3h N.Y., concerning Union troop movements.

scopecontent.p: John S. Miller, Camp Scofield, St. Louis, [Mo.], to Etta Adee, Barrington, Yates Co., N.Y.
John Adee, Little Rock, Ark., to "sister," Etta Adee, Barrington, Yates Co., N.Y.
John Adee, Little Rock, Ark., to "sister," Etta Adee, Barrington, Yates Co., N.Y.
John Adee, Little Rock, Ark., to "sister," Etta Adee, Barrington, Yates Co., N.Y.
John Adee, Algiers, La., to "sister," Etta Adee, n.p.
